titled: Afghanistan: Biden was advised to keep 2,500 troops, say generals
descriptiond: Top US generals recommended keeping 2,500 troops, but the president said he did not recall this advice.

titled: Capital Gazette shooting: 'No one could ever kill this paper'
descriptiond: Relatives of five journalists killed in 2018 attack speak out as shooter is jailed for life.

titled: Wayne Jenkins from behind bars: 'I sold drugs as a dirty cop'
descriptiond: He led a rogue police force who were jailed for a long list of crimes. Now in a BBC exclusive he explains why.

titled: Obamas break ground on controversial Chicago presidential centre
descriptiond: After years of dispute and legal rows, former President Obama's major legacy project is underway.

titled: R. Kelly found guilty in sex trafficking trial
descriptiond: After decades of allegations, the singer is convicted of running a scheme to abuse women and children.

titled: Most trapped Canadian miners rescued after two days
descriptiond: Thirty-five miners are rescued after climbing a distance of over 1km on a series of ladders.

titled: Covid-19: President Joe Biden receives Pfizer booster jab
descriptiond: The US President and other Americans over 65 are now eligible for a third jab of the Pfizer vaccine.

titled: Tony Awards: US TV audience slumps to all-time low
descriptiond: CBS says 2.6 million people tuned in for Sunday's two-hour special, down from 5.4 million in 2019.

titled: Infrastructure bill: $1tn for clean energy, internet, trains and more
descriptiond: The $1tn bill takes aim at issues from buckling bridges to global warming and remote working.

titled: Simone Biles says she 'should have quit way before' Tokyo Olympic Games
descriptiond: Four-time Olympic champion Simone Biles says she "should have quit way before Tokyo" after withdrawing from five of her six finals in Japan.

titled: Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou freed by Canada arrives home in China
descriptiond: Two Canadians detained by China are also freed, bringing to an end a three-year diplomatic row.

titled: Moulin Rouge! The Musical sweeps Tony Awards
descriptiond: The stage adaptation of the 2001 film wins 10 prizes at celebration of theatre in New York.

titled: Tuesday teaser: Test your news knowledge

titled: What it's like to be a nine-year-old in a vaccine clinical trial

titled: R. Kelly trial: A look at the key moments after star found guilty

titled: Haitian migrants at US border: 'We've been through 11 countries'

titled: Why are so many Haitians at the US-Mexico border?

titled: Gabby Petito case: The missing Americans you don't hear about

titled: Covid vaccine stockpiles: Could 241m doses go to waste?

titled: The mother and son who waited 58 years for a hug

titled: Twitch hate raids: Minority streamers have 'a target on their back'

titled: Angry scenes at Haiti airport as deported migrants arrive

titled: Migrants in Texas: US probes horseback charge on Haiti migrants
descriptiond: Images which seem to show border agents on horseback driving migrants back spark an investigation.

titled: Colombia: Migrants risking it all to cross Darien Gap
descriptiond: It takes up to 20 days, and can be deadly â€“ but everyday hundreds try to cross the border between Panama and Colombia.

titled: Covid: Biden to continue Trump's Title 42 migrant expulsions
descriptiond: The White House plans to continue the controversial Title 42 policy to help combat Covid-19.

titled: 'Our first day of freedom on American soil'
descriptiond: Adrian Meza and his family from Nicaragua have just been released from detention by US border officials.

titled: 'Heartbreaking' conditions in US migrant child camp
descriptiond: An investigation by the BBC has uncovered alarming conditions at a child migrant camp in Texas.

titled: US migrant camp 'kids feel like they're in prison'
descriptiond: More than 2,000 migrant children are being detained in an overcrowded camp in Texas ridden with disease.

titled: Mexico: Risking everything for an American dream
descriptiond: Thousands of migrants from Central America are making an arduous journey to the US border.

titled: Children speak of neglect in US asylum camps
descriptiond: The BBC has uncovered allegations of cold temperatures, sickness, lice and abuse, through a series of interviews with children and staff at US detention camps for children.

titled: Guatemala: Suffocated youth unafraid of a deadly journey

titled: Immigration: Is US-Mexico border seeing a surge in migrants?
descriptiond: Donald Trump says migrants are crossing the border like the US "has never seen". We've checked the numbers.

titled: Fashion house in backlash over 'racist' $1,190 sweatpants
descriptiond: Critics say the $1,190 pants, which come with a built-in pair of boxer shorts, rip off US hip hop culture.

titled: 'Black national anthem' makes its debut at the NFL
descriptiond: The song "Lift every Voice and Sing" will be played regularly at American football games this season.

titled: Dontae Sharpe: 'My 26-year fight to prove my innocence'

titled: Why was this US athlete 'too tall' to race?

titled: Elijah McClain: Five officials charged in black man's death

titled: FBI hate crime reports spike to 12-year high in 2020

titled: Biden's unlikely plan to use roads to fight racism

titled: The devastating human cost of rising US gun violence

titled: US census: Hispanic and Asian-American driving US population growth
descriptiond: Newly released data points to sluggish population growth and a more multiracial US.

titled: Global heating: Study shows impact of 'climate racism' in US
descriptiond: Black people in the US are subject to double the level of heat stress in cities than whites.

titled: How US police training compares with the rest of the world

titled: My husband and son fought in Afghanistan - it changed all of us
descriptiond: America's two decades in Afghanistan impacted those who served - and the families waiting at home.

titled: From Katrina to Ida: How US presidents react to climate change and natural disasters

titled: Canada election: Why it takes 30 years to buy a house in Canada
descriptiond: Canada's skyrocketing housing costs have become a key election issue this year.

titled: Canadian prairie ranchers struggle with drought conditions
descriptiond: Amid a severe drought in the Prairies, some ranchers are trying to find ways to work with nature.

titled: Olympic gymnasts give powerful testimony about sexual abuse
descriptiond: Gymnasts Simone Biles and McKayla Maroney testified before the Senate about Larry Nassar's abuse.

titled: Match crowd catches falling cat in a flag
descriptiond: The cat used one of its nine lives at the American football match in Miami Gardens, Florida.

titled: Condoleezza Rice reflects on 9/11 call
descriptiond: Bush's national security adviser Condoleezza Rice remembers the day she received the call informing her about 9/11.

titled: Tom Malinowski: US-Afghanistan conflict to continue
descriptiond: Democratic US Congressman Tom Malinowski says US troops will continue counter-terrorism strikes.

titled: Robert E Lee: Confederate general statue removed in Virginia
descriptiond: After a long legal battle, the Robert E Lee monument came down in the former Confederate capital.

titled: Esports: Why are there so few professional women gamers?
descriptiond: There are no female players in the top 300 earners in esports, according to research shared with BBC News.

titled: Storm Ida aftermath: 'I can't even count my losses from the flooding right now'
descriptiond: Residents in the US north-east assess the scale of the devastation caused by Tropical Storm Ida.

titled: Storm Ida: Floodwater pours into New York City subway station
descriptiond: Videos also show passengers on flooded buses and cars being swept away, after record rainfall from Storm Ida.

titled: Millions of Americans at risk of eviction
descriptiond: After a Covid-era ban on evictions ends, millions of Americans are at risk of losing their homes.

titled: Caldor Fire: Thousands flee as Lake Tahoe under threat
descriptiond: Traffic clogs evacuation routes as residents and tourists flee from the encroaching Caldor Fire.

titled: Biden defends pulling US troops out before all Americans evacuated
descriptiond: Joe Biden defends his decision to pull US troops out of Afghanistan before all Americans were evacuated.

titled: Bodies of US troops killed in Kabul returned to America
descriptiond: A "dignified transfer" ceremony takes place at Dover Air Force Base, Delaware, to receive their remains.

titled: Delta variant: How to keep kids safe as they return to school
descriptiond: A return to school for millions of children has many parents worried how to keep kids safe.

titled: Towering twin waterspouts spotted by Florida beachgoers
descriptiond: Twin funnels forming from the sky to the sea off the Florida coast surprised beachgoers.

titled: CEO Secrets: 'Tear up the business plan'

titled: Storm Henri: Lightning strikes One World Trade Center
descriptiond: The strike was captured as Storm Henri approached the north-east of the US, bringing heavy rain.

titled: Turmoil in Afghanistan hits close to home in America too

titled: New York officer rescues fallen man from subway train

titled: How technology in the air battles fires on the ground
descriptiond: Planes equipped with infrared scanners are helping authorities take on historic wildfires in the US.

titled: Canada 'Sixties Scoop': Indigenous survivors map out their stories

titled: New Christmas campaign for Canadians held in China
descriptiond: The campaign is based on efforts around a similar case involving a British journalist fifty years ago.

titled: New Brunswick outbreak: How a smalltown doctor became a Covid pariah
descriptiond: After being labelled "patient zero", a small-town physician in Canada was shunned.
